blackengine.userInput

Class InputManager<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • blackengine.userInput.InputManager<T>

  • public class InputManager<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    An instance of InputManager makes sure to handle all input specified in the provided key mapper. Components and other parts of the game can subscribe to either the mouse observable or the action observable.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      InputManager(KeyActionMapper<T> keyActionMapper)
      Default constructor for creating a new instance of InputManager.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void createEngine()
      Creates the InputEngine, which can be used to retrieve either observable at any point.
      void destroyEngine()
      Destroys the InputEngine
      void destroySubjects()
      Calls onCompleted() on the subjects and sets them to null.
      io.reactivex.Observable<T> getActionObservable()
      Getter for the instance of Observable<T> that can be subscribed to in order to receive actions.
      io.reactivex.Observable<MouseEvent> getMouseObservable()
      Getter for the instance of Observable<MouseEvent> that can be subscribed to in order to receive the events.
      void handleInput()
      Handles all input for the application.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • InputManager

        public InputManager(KeyActionMapper<T> keyActionMapper)
        Default constructor for creating a new instance of InputManager.
        Parameters:
        keyActionMapper - An instance of KeyActionMapper that will be used to iterate over the keyboards state and events to send out actions through the action observable.

    • Method Detail

      • getActionObservable

        public io.reactivex.Observable<T> getActionObservable()
        Getter for the instance of Observable<T> that can be subscribed to in order to receive actions.
        Returns:
        An instance of Observable<T>.

      • getMouseObservable

        public io.reactivex.Observable<MouseEvent> getMouseObservable()
        Getter for the instance of Observable<MouseEvent> that can be subscribed to in order to receive the events.
        Returns:
        An instance of Observable<MouseEvent>.

      • createEngine

        public void createEngine()
        Creates the InputEngine, which can be used to retrieve either observable at any point. Best practice is to call this method within the setUp() method inside an implementation of ApplicationManager.

      • destroyEngine

        public void destroyEngine()
        Destroys the InputEngine

      • destroySubjects

        public void destroySubjects()
        Calls onCompleted() on the subjects and sets them to null.

      • handleInput

        public void handleInput()
        Handles all input for the application. This should be called from the game loop (already defined in ApplicationManager.
